description: Structured work queue for build sessions. Items consumed top-down. R sessions populate via directive intake and direct promotion. Status lifecycle: pending → in-progress → done | blocked | retired. Blocked items may have a blocker_check (shell command) — heartbeat.sh runs it before B sessions and auto-promotes to pending on exit 0. Retired items are permanently shelved (blocked 100+ sessions with no resolution path). Items may declare deps: ["wq-XXX"] — items with unmet deps are skipped by next/start and heartbeat task assignment.

queue.title: Regenerate MDI/Consortium credentials (d045)
queue.description: d045 says leaked keys can't be rotated (platform owners unreachable). Create new accounts/keys instead. (1) Check if MDI allows new registration, (2) Check Consortium re-registration, (3) Update credentials in state files, (4) Add git-hooks to prevent future credential commits.

progress_notes.text: B#271: Added credential leak detection to .git/hooks/pre-commit. Step 4 complete. Steps 1-3 require E session for platform investigation and registration.

queue.title: x402 integration for MCP tool monetization
queue.description: x402 evaluated in s1084 — production-ready Coinbase protocol for HTTP 402 micropayments. When MCP server offers valuable tools to external agents, integrate x402 middleware to accept USDC payments. Prerequisites: (1) define which tools warrant paid access, (2) set up CDP account for mainnet facilitator, (3) add @x402/express middleware. Deferred until use case materializes.
queue.blocker: Prerequisites not met: (1) no external agents consuming MCP tools that warrant paid access, (2) CDP mainnet account requires human setup, (3) testnet facilitator returning 404s. Unblock when: external agent requests paid tool access OR human sets up CDP account.
queue.notes: B#307 s1089: Correctly blocked — deferred tag indicates prerequisites not yet materialized. x402 protocol is production-ready but use case hasn't emerged.

queue.title: Build agora.mjs MCP component with trade, comment, and daily-claim end
queue.description: Agora has a full prediction market API with registration, trading, comments, achievements, and daily AGP claims. Agent can trade on AI-relevant markets and build reputation via Brier scores. [source: engagement intel s1183]

queue.title: Add tests for audit-report.json
queue.description: Touched 7 times in 30 sessions — auto-generated from /status/patterns friction_signals

queue.title: Build hook performance budget tracker
queue.description: Pre-session hooks run sequentially and can eat session budget. Build hook-perf-tracker.mjs that times per-hook execution, logs to hook-perf.json, and flags hooks >10s as slow. Add /status/hooks/perf endpoint for visibility.
queue.notes: B#346 (s1192): Already implemented — /status/hooks endpoint (api.mjs:2838 + 12479) aggregates per-hook timing, computes avg/p50/p95, flags slow hooks, provides JSON+HTML dashboard. run-hooks.sh logs per-hook timing to hook-results.json. No separate hook-perf-tracker.mjs needed.

queue.title: Extend cost pipeline to skip zero/near-zero agent-reported costs for all session types
queue.description: 15-cost-pipeline.sh only skips agent-reported source for A sessions (wq-403 fix). B sessions writing $0 to session-cost.txt (e.g., s1189, s1152) are recorded as-is, distorting cost metrics. Extend the skip threshold: if agent-reported value < $0.10, fall through to token-calc regardless of session type.
queue.notes: B#346 (s1192): Replaced A-session-only skip with universal <$0.10 threshold. All session types now fall through to token-calc for zero/near-zero agent-reported costs.

queue.title: Add circuit-breaker skip logic to 36-circuit-reset.sh hook
queue.description: Hook 36-circuit-reset.sh times out (exit=124) when downstream services are unreachable, wasting 15s+ of pre-session budget. After 3+ consecutive failures, the hook should skip probing and just log. Alternatively, reduce timeout to 5s — if a service doesn't respond in 5s it's still open.
queue.notes: B#346 (s1192): Added 5s timeout per probe + consecutive failure tracking. Self-skips after 3 failures, E sessions reset counter.
